com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface monitorItemAvailability

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface monitorItemAvailability

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document monitorItemAvailability(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The monitorItemAvailability API is used to monitor the availability of an item using the same logic as the logic of the Real-Time Availability Monitor agent.

    • Method Detail

      • monitorItemAvailability

        org.w3c.dom.Document monitorItemAvailability(YFSEnvironment env,
                                             org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                      throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                             java.rmi.RemoteException

        The monitorItemAvailability API is used to monitor the availability of an item using the same logic as the logic of the Real-Time Availability Monitor agent. The API accepts the information of an item for which will be monitored. It returns back a list of inventory alerts with the availability information for the item provided. This API can be used to manually monitor and obtain availability information especially the computed ship dates in the case when no inventory activity occurs for the item.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOverriddenDGForItemUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPGetSourcingCorrectionsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPGetSourcedFromNodesExternallyUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetDeliveryLeadTimeUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetDistanceUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.OMPDetermineBestMultiStopTransferUE
        *
          When yfs.rtam.algorithm is set to 00 (Deprecated as of 9.2.1), refer to the user exits of the findInventory API.
          When yfs.rtam.algorithm is set to 01 (Deprecated as of 9.3.0), the following user exits will be called.

            com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemListUE

            com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE

        Events Raised: The Following Event is raised.

        REALTIME_ATP_MONITOR.REALTIME_AVAILABILITY_CHANGE_LIST:
        This event is raised upon successful execution of the monitorItemAvailability API.
        Data published - YFS_REALTIME_ATP_MONITOR.REALTIME_AVAILABILITY_CHANGE_LIST.xml
        Key data - AVAILABILITY_MONITOR_dbd.txt
        Template Support - Yes.

        REALTIME_ATP_MONITOR.REALTIME_AVAILABILITY_CHANGE:
        Deprecated. As of 9.5 this has been replaced by REALTIME_ATP_MONITOR.REALTIME_AVAILABILITY_CHANGE_LIST.
        This event is raised upon successful execution of the monitorItemAvailability API if the above event is not configured.
        Data published - YFS_REALTIME_ATP_MONITOR.REALTIME_AVAILABILITY_CHANGE.xml
        Key data - AVAILABILITY_MONITOR_dbd.txt
        Template Support - Yes.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post Conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Additional Information:

        API throws error if availability is maintained externally for primary enterprise code of inventory organization or ShipNode.

        Smart Sourcing

        If smart sourcing is enabled for the organization, then the latitude, longitude, and estimated costs will be dynamically calculated for the node specific alerts that get updated.

        Procurement

        When availability is calculated and the ATP Level is determined to be below the configured threshold in the inventory monitor rule, procurement sourcing rules will be read for the node. The procurement sourcing rules will be determined based on the fulfillment types configured for the inventory monitor rules. All nodes applicable for procurement (across all the sourcing rules for that item across all details) will be considered for determining availability (across order classification for example). Availability will be monitored at these nodes as well. So if node level is enabled for the ship nodes requiring procurements, then node level alerts will be created for the procurement nodes as well. The procured quantity will be included in the ProcuredQuantity attribute, however it will not affect the future available thresholds or alert levels. The attribute, ProcurementLeadTime, will be the max number of hours in the transfer schedule for the lead days. If dynamic shipment date calculation is enabled and the alert level is beyond the desired threshold, shipment dates will be recomputed for the node to include the notification schedules, receiving calendars, receipt processing times, transfer schedule cutoffs, and transfer schedules for procurements. The alert details for the ship node will be associated with the procurement node's respective details.

        Open Quantity Distribution

        When an order is created without a ship node, any quantity in this order is considered open quantity demand. The open quantity distribution feature enables OPEN_ORDER demands with no ship node to be distributed among distribution groups based on their configured priorities. This enables a more improved inventory availability picture on these prioritized distribution groups prior to the order being scheduled. The monitor rule must be enabled for these distribution groups for this functionality to take place.

        The priority for a distribution group is configured by including a common code attribute of Priority to the existing distribution group configuration in manageCommonCode. The value of priority must be an integer. For example:

        <CommonCode CodeName="MyDistributionGroup1" CodeType="DIST_GRP_LVL_MTR" CodeValue="MyDistributionGroupKey"...../>
<CommonCodeAttributeList>
<CommonCodeAttribute Name="Priority" Value="1"/>
</CommonCodeAttributeList>
</CommonCode>

        Consider two scenarios with and without the open quantity distribution feature. Assume there are two distribution groups, DG1 and DG2. 

        Scenario 1 (without distribution)
1) DG1 (OnhandQuantity=5 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=0)
2) DG2 (OnhandQuantity=5 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=0)
2) DG3 (OnhandQuantity=5 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=0)
        An OPEN_ORDER demand for 7 quantity has been created in the system. However, without this feature, there are no prioritized distribution groups, so the inventory picture never gets updated for *either distribution group.
        Scenario 2 (with distribution)
1) DG1 (OnhandQuantity=5 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=0) [Priority:2]
2) DG2 (OnhandQuantity=5 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=0) [Priority:1]
3) DG3 ((OnhandQuantity=5 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=0) [No Priority]
        Since DG3 does not have priority configured, it will not be considered for distribution, so the quantity at DG3 remains unchanged. After RTAM processes quantity, the open quantity total of 7 will be distributed between DG1 and DG2. Since DG2 has a higher priority, it is used first to consume OPEN_ORDER demand and any remaining demand will be carried over to DG1. This yields the final inventory picture.
        1) DG1 (OnhandQuantity=3 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=2) [Priority:2]
2) DG2 (OnhandQuantity=0 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=5) [Priority:1]
3) DG3 ((OnhandQuantity=5 Demand=0 UnassignedOnhand=0) [No Priority] (Unchanged)

        In scenario 2, given that the quantities on the alert have been changed on prioritized distribution groups, the inventory alert record will be updated and events will be raised if conditions are met.

        After open quantity is distributed, the following inventory alert columns are affected:

        1. ONHAND_AVAILABLE_QUANTITY - This quantity will be deducted by the amount of open quantity and the open quantity is moved to the UnassignedOnhandQuantity column.
        2. FUTURE_AVAILABLE_QUANTITY - If there is no more OnhandAvailableQuantity remaining in a distribution group, then this quantity will be deducted from and any open quantity is moved to the UnassignedFutureQuantity column.
        3. UNASSIGNED_ONHAND_QUANTITY - This quantity represents the amount of OPEN_ORDER demand distributed to the OnhandAvailableQuantity column for this distribution group.
        4. UNASSIGNED_FUTURE_QUANTITY - This quantity represents the amount of OPEN_ORDER demand distributed to the FutureAvailableQuantity column for this distribution group. The future quantity will be considered after all OnhandAvailableQuantity is consumed, then quantity will begin to be consumed at the next prioritized distribution group.

        For example:

        Consider DG1 (OnhandAvailableQuantity=5, FutureAvailableQuantity=3, UnassignedOnhandQuantity=0, UnassignedFutureQuantity=0,) and 10 OPEN_ORDER demand in the system. At the end of the RTAM execution, all OnhandQuantity and FutureQuantity will be consumed and moved to the respective UNASSIGNED columns. Any remaining undistributed OPEN_ORDER demand will be allocated to the next prioritized distribution group. This leaves the inventory picture as follows:

        DG1 (OnhandQuantity=0 FutureQuantity=0 UnassignedOnhandQuantity=5 UnassignedFutureQuantity=3) with 2 remaining open quantity allocated to the distribution group with the next-highest priority.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
